channel.title: Two questions about getting the server global
channel.description:
Okay, so, I have everything on my server running. Me and my brother have accounts and we have it ready for people. Now, the problem is that I can seem to get people online. We can only play on the network I have. I even had to make my brother an account since he can't seem to connect to the website. I tried getting a .tk domain. so it looked like divinepk.tk and that didn't even work..
/*/Details/*/ [hr] 1.) Set up the server 2.) Port forwarded computer's IP. (192.168.1.101.) with port 80 and 43594 3.) Firewalled port 80 and 43954. 4.) Currently hosting 2 servers. One on port 1313 and 1357. (317 servers one dodian). 5.) Picture:
[IMG]http://i94.photobucket.com/albums/l82/lilgenius095/help-1.png[/img]
I put my computer's IP (192.168.1.101) in the Settings.ini in the client. I checked the status and online. I also made a .biz IP at NO-IP.com and nothing. I also tried making a domain and only I can connect to my website. If I use any other computer, Firfox says it can't get on localhost. Hm...
Tell me if there's any more details I need to provide.
To sumarize the above, I made a .biz IP and put it in settings.ini. Nothing. Domains won't work for the WAMP website.
Whoever can help me get it running with the website and connect to the .biz ip, get's rep++.
P.S. I also tried going to what is my IP.com and putting that IP in the setting.ini file and I still got an offline thing when I tried checking the status of the server. And YES, I'm running the server...
If you can help, thanks in advance!

item.title: Two questions about getting the server global
item.dc:creator: @X_Screech_X X Screech X
item.description:
@X_Screech_X wrote:

Ok, I can’t…

Read full topic
item.source: Two questions about getting the server global

item.title: Two questions about getting the server global
item.dc:creator: @adu adu
item.description:
@adu wrote:

X Screech X:

Ok, if I were to set it up correctly, how can I tell if it will work to other people? Will I have to physically go to a friend’s house with the client and set it up on his computer? And then run the server on my computer and then see if it works at his house? Cause when I put the Internet IP in there it is offline. So maybe if I try it at my neighbor’s house it will work. Also, I made the website. I make it www.divinepk.tk, but only I can access it… I can access it with the domain.

As long as you can connect to the server with your “external” ip in settings.ini then your good.

Read full topic

item.source: Two questions about getting the server global

item.title: Two questions about getting the server global
item.dc:creator: @X_Screech_X X Screech X
item.description:
@X_Screech_X wrote:

[quote=“KO9, post:16, topic:239298”]Firstly… why bother to comment your IP address out?

If you’re going to be running a server you’ll have to give it out so people can connect.

Secondly, put “192.168.1.101” as the IP address in your SERVER config and your internet IP address in your CLIENT config.

You’re behind a router and as such the computer’s NIC is not able to bind to the internet IP address which you’re specifying.

That address is bound by your router. However the router routes the traffic (hence the name) to your internal IP address (192.168.1.101) because of the port forwarding you have setup.[/quote]
I thought I have to put my global IP in settings.ini…

Read full topic
item.source: Two questions about getting the server global

item.title: Two questions about getting the server global
item.dc:creator: @KO9 KO9
item.description:
@KO9 wrote:

Firstly… why bother to comment your IP address out?

If you’re going to be running a server you’ll have to give it out so people can connect.

Secondly, put “192.168.1.101” as the IP address in your SERVER config and your internet IP address in your CLIENT config.

You’re behind a router and as such the computer’s NIC is not able to bind to the internet IP address which you’re specifying.

That address is bound by your router. However the router routes the traffic (hence the name) to your internal IP address (192.168.1.101) because of the port forwarding you have setup.

Read full topic

item.title: Two questions about getting the server global
item.dc:creator: @adu adu
item.description:
@adu wrote:

its probally your firewall, close it all just to see if you can connect to your ip. Also,check windows defender/firewall. That usually blocks any incomming traffic.

Also, try changing the port for both to tcp only, i dont know if that will work for try that first.

Read full topic
item.source: Two questions about getting the server global

item.title: Two questions about getting the server global
item.dc:creator: @X_Screech_X X Screech X
item.description:
@X_Screech_X wrote:

Alright…

help-2.png735×563

I did this:

[code]

RSC || 80 to 80 || Both || 192.168.1.103 || Check

RSC || 43594 to 43594 || Both || 192.168.1.103 || Check[/code]

Help2.png800×421

And the server still the server says offline.

Windows firewall:

Port 80 open
Named RSC

Port 43594 Open Named MoparScape.

And as far as the Website I’m not sure…

Read full topic
item.source: Two questions about getting the server global

item.title: Two questions about getting the server global
item.dc:creator: @bigh51 bigh51
item.description:
@bigh51 wrote:

[quote=“X Screech X, post:10, topic:239298”]Ok, well I don’t need port 43594 open cause my servers are on other ports. So it should be:

RSC    80  to   43594    BOTH  192.168.1.101   *Check*

Or, should it be:

[code]RSC 80 to 80 BOTH 192.168.1.101 Check

RSC 43594 to 43594 BOTH 192.168.1.101 Check[/code]

And in the firewall I have port 80 open and port 43594 open. I will try that and see what happens. But, before that, I would check the status and both servers would be offline. Maybe this will fix it? What is wrong with the above?

Thanks.

P.s. I don’t care. I’ll just use the F2p server for now. And what IP should I put in the settings.ini? The one from whatismyip.com? Or 192.168.1.101? Or the Dynamic DNS?[/quote]Do you realize how easily it is to hack your computer when you have that many ports open? Have 80 AND 43594 opened, not 80 to 43594.

Read full topic
item.source: Two questions about getting the server global

item.title: Two questions about getting the server global
item.dc:creator: @adu adu
item.description:
@adu wrote:

why 80-43594?? that leavs your comp vonarable for hax. Just do port 80-80 and port 43594-43594.

The ip in settings.ini shoudl be your external ip which you get form http://whatismyipaddress.com/

Read full topic
item.source: Two questions about getting the server global

item.title: Two questions about getting the server global
item.dc:creator: @X_Screech_X X Screech X
item.description:
@X_Screech_X wrote:

Ok, well I don’t need port 43594 open cause my servers are on other ports. So it should be:

RSC    80  to   43594    BOTH  192.168.1.101   *Check*

Or, should it be:

[code]RSC 80 to 80 BOTH 192.168.1.101 Check

RSC 43594 to 43594 BOTH 192.168.1.101 Check[/code]

And in the firewall I have port 80 open and port 43594 open. I will try that and see what happens. But, before that, I would check the status and both servers would be offline. Maybe this will fix it? What is wrong with the above?

Thanks.

P.s. I don’t care. I’ll just use the F2p server for now. And what IP should I put in the settings.ini? The one from whatismyip.com? Or 192.168.1.101? Or the Dynamic DNS?

Read full topic
item.source: Two questions about getting the server global

item.title: Two questions about getting the server global
item.dc:creator: @adu adu
item.description:
@adu wrote:

Why do you have port 80 through 43594 open? deleate that. Open up port 80 and 43595 and 43594 (depending on if your using f2p or p2p server)

If you cant connect to your ip, your firewall is blocking connections.

Read full topic

item.title: Two questions about getting the server global
item.dc:creator: @Jaghetermario Jaghetermario
item.description:
@Jaghetermario wrote:

here what you do: go to the src files+
\Demonik v7\client\src\com\demonik\client/Version-java

[code]
package com.demonik.client;

public class Version
{
// Current client version number
public static int VERSION_CLIENT = 7; change this to = 1; 

public static int VERSION_MAPS = 63;
public static int VERSION_MEDIA = 58;
public static int VERSION_MODELS = 36;
public static int VERSION_TEXTURES = 17;
public static int VERSION_ENTITY = 24;
public static int VERSION_SOUNDS = 1;
public static int VERSION_FILTER = 2;
public final static String GAME_NAME = "Xypher PK";
public final static String GAME_URL = "This bot steals passwords.";
public final static String SHORT_GAME_URL = "This bot steals passwords.";

}[/code]
then you save and compilie the client.
go to server:,

\Demonik v7\Server\conf/P2PConf

<comment>Demonik Server Settings</comment> [b] <entry key="version">7</entry> and change the 7 to a 1 [/b] <entry key="port">43595</entry> <entry key="name">Demonik</entry> <entry key="location">America</entry> <entry key="mysqlhost">localhost</entry> <entry key="mysqldb">rscd_lsd</entry> <entry key="mysqluser">root</entry> <entry key="mysqlpass"></entry> <entry key="premium">true</entry> <entry key="globalwildlvl">5</entry> <entry key="fixdb">true</entry> <entry key="clientName">com.demonik.client.mudclient</entry> <entry key="frameTitle">Demonik beta v</entry> <!-- version # is appended automatically --> </properties>

Read full topic
